DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare incidence urinary retention requirement bladder catheterization patient undergoing total knee arthroplasty receive either continuous epidural analgesia single shot femoral nerve block .
DOC.brief_title: Incidence Urinary Retention Patients Undergoing Unilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty- Comparison Between Continuous Epidural Analgesia Single Shot Femoral Nerve Block- Randomized Controlled Study ( UriKANE )
DOC.criteria: ASA Physical status I , II & III Male Female Patients age 30 70 year Unilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty Patient Refusal Allergy local anesthetic , paracetamol study drug History opioid dependence Contraindications spinal/epidural anesthesia femoral nerve block ( coagulation defect , infection puncture site etc . ) Inability use patientcontrolled analgesia ( IV PCIA ) ( assessed time informed consent ) History urinary retention , neurogenic bladder , urologic problem
